comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Mary Garden (1874-1967), Scottish soprano. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Garden I assume this was publicity related to her starring role in Victor Herbert's "Natoma": en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natoma Other photos of opera singer Mary Garden in the LOC stream: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3065187159/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3066027708/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3066026316/]

comment.author: 8574853@N05
comment._content:
Fine Native Americans in their traditional garb.
Wonderful to see, I enlarged this to the hilt and
inspected every tiny detail for about 30 minutes.
Sheer bliss.  The hat netting on Mary's face is
enchanting. My Mom had hats with that back in
the 'olden days'. Great to see this photograph.

comment.author: 96179722@N00
comment._content: I think it's so interesting to see how the lady and the Native Americans use many of the same materials in their finery, but the overall look is completely different.  Both are wearing animal fur on their bodies and feathers on their heads.   But the effect is completely different.
